title: Chelsea to make late £30m bid for Celtic's star striker? Transfer news and gossip from Tuesday's papers
text:
Sport Chelsea to make late £30m bid for Celtic's star striker? Transfer news and gossip from Tuesday's papers PLUS: West Brom have made it clear to a Chinese Super League club that Salomon Rondon isn't for sale Share Moussa Dembele is attracting late interest from the Premier League giants (Photo: Ian MacNicol/Getty Images) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Chelsea are deciding whether or not to lodge a late £30million bid for Celtic’s Moussa Dembele. 
The Scottish giants have put a hefty price tag on the France Under-21 and have little desire to sell him. 
But the Guardian says the bean counters at Parkhead have given a valuation and now the ball is in the Premier League leaders court. 
Dembele’s continued improvement and goals return after signing a four-year contract last summer has made him hot property. 
Here’s more of the top stories from transfer deadline day. Read More Transfer deadline day LIVE: Manchester United, Arsenal, Liverpool and Chelsea latest as window slams shut Transfer news and gossip from the Daily Mirror 
Odion Ighalo will become English football's latest concession to the Great Wad of China after Watford agreed a £20million deal with Chongchun Yatai for the Nigerian striker. 
Chelsea are trying to rush through a deal for Schalke defender Sead Kolasinac after Branislav Ivanovic agreed to join Zenit St Petersburg. Blues boss Antonio Conte is trying to gazump former club Juventus in the battle to sign the Schalke left back. Chelsea have granted Ivanovic a free transfer and the long-serving defender has now agreed a two and a half year contract at Zenit. Conte wants Kolasinac (Photo: Bongarts/Getty) 
Andros Townsend will cost Newcastle £15million to loan back and then buy - if they get promoted. Crystal Palace are demanding a £2million loan fee until the end of the season. Then they want the £13million buy out clause in his contract paid in full in the summer – meaning Newcastle will be handing Palace more than they sold him for seven months ago. 
West Ham are facing a desperate three-way battle to sign Scott Hogan. Crystal Palace boss Sam Allardyce has made an enquiry for the Brentford striker while West Brom are also interested. It sets up a desperate deadline day battle with Brentford holding out for £15m and the Championship club insist that their price has yet to be matched. 
Celtic manager Brendan Rodgers has reiterated that Craig Gordon will still be at Parkhead after the transfer window. Chelsea were reported to have made a second bid for the Scotland goalkeeper but Rodgers' stance has not shifted. A three-way battle is brewing for Hogan (Photo: West London) 
Ronald Koeman has revealed he is keen on a last gasp attempt to snatch Michael Keane from Burnley. But the Everton manager admitted his club are not the only side who have targeted the top class defender before the transfer window closes on Tuesday night. 
Aston Villa are set to sell Ashley Westwood to Premier League Burnley as Steve Bruce continues his big revamp. Villa boss Bruce, who succeeded Roberto Di Matteo in October, has been busy this month with five signings. 
Manolo Gabbiadini is due to have a Southampton medical on Tuesday after they agreed a £17.2m deal with Napoli. The two clubs finally reached an agreement today after weeks of on-off negotiations for the Italy forward. Manolo Gabbiadini is set to become a Saint (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
Cameron McGeehan could be in line for one of January's most extraordinary transfers – just a month after breaking his leg. The Luton midfielder is due to miss the rest of the season after his serious injury for the Hatters at Portsmouth on January 2 in a League Two clash. But MirrorSport understands Championship Barnsley are giving serious thought to signing the starlet for £500,000 this month. 
Tim Krul is being lined up to join Watford on Deadline Day. Newcastle have offered the Dutch goalkeeper, 28, to Premier League clubs after he failed to play even once on loan in his homeland with Ajax. Gossip from other newspapers and websites 
Tianjin Quanjian have made a £32million offer for Salomon Rondon but have been told by West Brom that he is not for sale in this window at any price. (Daily Mail) 
Arsenal are close to strengthening their defensive options in the summer after agreeing personal terms with Roma defender Kostas Manolas (WhoScored.com) 
Tomi Juric could be on his way to England, with a Swiss newspaper claiming Championship club Reading are preparing a late bid for the Socceroos striker. (Goal.com) Like us on Facebook
